skill.name: research-merge
skill.description: Processes research branches from Claude Code Web sessions - merges content, moves docs to docs/research/, and creates GitHub issues. Use when /popkit:next detects research branches or when manually processing research from mobile sessions. Do NOT use for regular feature branches - only for branches matching claude/research-* or containing research documentation.

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate research management skill that handles git operations for research branches. The static scanner produced numerous false positives due to pattern matching heuristics that do not apply to this context. All git commands are hardcoded strings for legitimate repository operations. File system access is limited to reading markdown research documents and writing merged output. No credentials are accessed or exfiltrated. The skill is safe for publication.

content.value_statement: Research branches pile up and become difficult to manage. This skill automatically detects, merges, and organizes research findings from Claude Code Web sessions into actionable GitHub issues.
actual_capabilities: Detects research branches matching claude/research-* pattern
Squash-merges research content to main branch
Moves research docs to docs/research/ directory
Creates GitHub issues from research findings
Cleans up remote branches after processing
Detects duplicate and conflicting research findings
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) for issue creation
Only processes branches with research documentation
Needs clean working directory before merging

best_practices: Review research content before merging to ensure quality and accuracy
Use descriptive titles in research documents for better issue generation
Include implementation tasks in research docs to create actionable issues
anti_patterns: Merging research without reviewing the content first
Creating research branches without proper documentation
Ignoring merge conflicts instead of resolving them manually

faq.question: What triggers research branch detection?
faq.answer: The skill runs when /popkit:next detects branches matching claude/research-* pattern, or when invoked manually

faq.question: Can I merge research without creating GitHub issues?
faq.answer: Yes, choose Merge only option to squash-merge content without creating an issue

faq.question: What happens to the original branch after merging?
faq.answer: The remote branch is automatically deleted, but you can skip this step if needed

faq.question: How does conflict detection work?
faq.answer: The skill analyzes text similarity and looks for contradictory statements like should vs should not

faq.question: Where are research documents moved?
faq.answer: Research docs are organized into docs/research/ directory with standardized naming

faq.question: What if I do not have GitHub CLI installed?
faq.answer: The skill will skip issue creation and notify you - the merge will still complete successfully
